# Diagnostics tools overview

> Troubleshooting application issues using logging, tracing, metrics, and debugging tools. Core tools include `dotnet-counters`, `dotnet-dump`, `dotnet-trace`, and `dotnet-monitor` for production diagnostics. Use `EventSource` and `DiagnosticSource` for custom instrumentation; OpenTelemetry for distributed tracing.

- [Well-known EventCounters in .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/available-counters.md): Review EventCounters published by the .NET runtime and libraries.
- [.NET extensions metrics](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/built-in-metrics-diagnostics.md): Review the metrics available for diagnostic .NET extensions libraries.
- [.NET runtime metrics](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/built-in-metrics-runtime.md): Review the metrics available for .NET runtime libraries.
- [System.Net metrics](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/built-in-metrics-system-net.md): Review the metrics available for System.Net
- [Built-in metrics in .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/built-in-metrics.md): Review the metrics built-in for the .NET runtime and libraries.
- [Collect Dumps on Crash](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/collect-dumps-crash.md): How to collect a dump on a crash
- [Understanding different metric APIs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/compare-metric-apis.md): A guide to the different metric APIs offered by .NET and third parties.
- [Debugging deadlock](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/debug-deadlock.md): A tutorial that walks you through debugging a locking issue in .NET Core.
- [Debug high CPU usage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/debug-highcpu.md): A tutorial that walks you through debugging high CPU usage in .NET Core.
- [Debug Linux dumps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/debug-linux-dumps.md): In this article, you'll learn how to collect and analyze dumps from Linux environments.
- [Debug a memory leak tutorial](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/debug-memory-leak.md): Learn how to debug a memory leak in .NET.
- [Debugging StackOverflow errors](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/debug-stackoverflow.md): Learn how to diagnose StackOverflow exceptions
- [Debug ThreadPool Starvation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/debug-threadpool-starvation.md): A tutorial that walks you through debugging and fixing a ThreadPool starvation issue on .NET Core
- [Debug Windows dumps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/debug-windows-dumps.md): In this article, you'll learn how to analyze dumps from Windows environments.
- [.NET debugger extensions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/debugger-extensions.md): Learn about the debugger extensions for .NET, which provide information about the internal CLR environment.
- [Exception summarization in C#](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/diagnostic-exception-summary.md): Learn the value proposition of exception summarization within diagnostic metrics for .NET app development.
- [App health checks in C#](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/diagnostic-health-checks.md): Learn how to use resource utilization and application lifetime health checks in .NET app development.
- [Diagnostic port](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/diagnostic-port.md): Learn about .NET diagnostic ports
- [Diagnostic resource monitoring](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/diagnostic-resource-monitoring.md): Learn how to use the diagnostic resource monitoring library in .NET.
- [Diagnostics client library](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/diagnostics-client-library.md): In this article, you'll learn how to use Microsoft.Diagnostics.NETCore.Client library to write your custom diagnostic tool.
- [Collect diagnostics in Linux containers](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/diagnostics-in-containers.md): Learn how .NET diagnostics tools for gathering performance traces and collecting dumps can be used in Linux containers.
- [DiagnosticSource and DiagnosticListener](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/diagnosticsource-diagnosticlistener.md): An overview of DiagnosticSource/DiagnosticListener including guidance on logging events, instrumenting code, and consuming data.
- [Built-in Activities in .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/distributed-tracing-builtin-activities.md): Overview of activities emitted by the .NET libraries
- [Collect a distributed trace](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/distributed-tracing-collection-walkthroughs.md): Tutorials to collect distributed traces in .NET applications using OpenTelemetry, Application Insights, or ActivityListener
- [Distributed tracing concepts](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/distributed-tracing-concepts.md): .NET distributed tracing concepts
- [Add distributed tracing instrumentation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/distributed-tracing-instrumentation-walkthroughs.md): A tutorial to instrument distributed traces in .NET applications
- [Distributed tracing](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/distributed-tracing.md): An introduction to .NET distributed tracing.
- [dotnet-counters diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-counters.md): Learn how to install and use the dotnet-counter CLI tool for ad-hoc health monitoring and first-level performance investigation.
- [dotnet-debugger-extensions diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-debugger-extensions.md): Learn how to install and use the dotnet-debugger-extensions CLI tool to manage the .NET debugging extensions, which is used with native debuggers on Windows and Linux.
- [dotnet-dsrouter](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-dsrouter.md): An introduction to dotnet-dsrouter in .NET.
- [dotnet-dump diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-dump.md): Learn how to install and use the dotnet-dump CLI tool to collect and analyze Windows and Linux dumps without any native debugger.
- [dotnet-gcdump diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-gcdump.md): Learn how to install and use dotnet-gcdump CLI tool to collect GC (Garbage Collector) dumps of live .NET processes using the .NET EventPipe.
- [dotnet-monitor diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-monitor.md): Learn how to install and use the dotnet-monitor tool to collect dumps, traces, logs, and metrics from applications in production environments.
- [dotnet-sos diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-sos.md): Learn how to install and use the dotnet-sos CLI tool to manage the SOS debugger extension, which is used with native debuggers on Windows and Linux.
- [dotnet-stack diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-stack.md): Learn how to install and use the dotnet-stack CLI tool which captures and prints the managed stacks for all threads in the target .NET process.
- [dotnet-symbol diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-symbol.md): Learn how to install and use the dotnet-symbol CLI tool to download files required for debugging .NET dumps and minidumps.
- [dotnet-trace diagnostic tool](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dotnet-trace.md): Learn how to install and use the dotnet-trace CLI tool to collect .NET traces of a running process without the native profiler, by using the .NET EventPipe.
- [Dumps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/dumps.md): An introduction to dumps in .NET.
- [Measure performance using EventCounters in .NET Core](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/event-counter-perf.md): In this tutorial, you'll learn how to measure performance using EventCounters.
- [EventCounters in .NET Core](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/event-counters.md): In this article, you'll learn what EventCounters are, how to implement them, and how to consume them.
- [EventPipe Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/eventpipe.md): Learn about EventPipe and how to use it for tracing your .NET applications to diagnose performance issues.
- [EventSource Activity IDs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/eventsource-activity-ids.md): Understand how to use EventSource Activity IDs
- [Collect and View EventSource Traces](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/eventsource-collect-and-view-traces.md): A tutorial for collecting and viewing traces of EventSource events
- [Getting Started with EventSource](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/eventsource-getting-started.md): A tutorial to create a basic EventSource and understand key concepts
- [Instrument Code to Create EventSource Events](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/eventsource-instrumentation.md): A tutorial for instrumenting code with EventSource
- [EventSource](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/eventsource.md): A guide to logging with EventSource
- [Diagnostics tools overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/index.md): An overview of the tools and techniques available to diagnose .NET Core applications.
- [Install and use LLDB on Linux](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/lldb-linux.md): Instructions for installing and using LLDB to debug a .NET application on Linux
- [Logging and tracing](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/logging-tracing.md): An introduction to .NET logging and tracing.
- [Managed debuggers](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/managed-debuggers.md): An overview of the Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code managed debuggers.
- [Collect metrics](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/metrics-collection.md): Tutorial to collect metrics in .NET applications
- [Compile-time metric source generation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/metrics-generator.md): Learn how to use a source generator to create metrics in .NET
- [Creating Metrics](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/metrics-instrumentation.md): How to add new metrics to a .NET library or application
- [Source-generated metrics with strongly-typed tags](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/metrics-strongly-typed.md): Learn how to use a source generator to create strongly-typed metric tags in .NET, reducing boilerplate and ensuring consistent.
- [Metrics Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/metrics.md): An overview on using metrics to monitor a .NET application
- [Microsoft.Diagnostics.NETCore.Client API](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/microsoft-diagnostics-netcore-client.md): In this article, you'll learn about the Microsoft.Diagnostics.NETCore.Client APIs.
- [Migrate from .NET Windows Performance Counters to .NET Core metrics](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/migrate-from-windows-performance-counters.md): Learn how to migrate from .NET Framework Windows Performance Counters to .NET Core/NET 5+ metrics using EventCounters and Meters.
- [Example: Use OpenTelemetry with Azure Monitor and Application Insights](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/observability-applicationinsights.md): A walkthrough of how to use OpenTelemetry in .NET to export telemetry to Application Insights
- [Example: Use OpenTelemetry with OTLP and the standalone Aspire Dashboard](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/observability-otlp-example.md): An introduction to observing .NET apps with OTLP and the standalone Aspire Dashboard
- [Example: Use OpenTelemetry with Prometheus, Grafana, and Jaeger](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/observability-prgrja-example.md): A walkthrough of how to use OpenTelemetry in .NET to export telemetry to Prometheus, Grafana, and Jaeger
- [.NET Observability with OpenTelemetry](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/observability-with-otel.md): An introduction to observing .NET apps with OpenTelemetry
- [Profiling tools in .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/profilers.md): An overview of .NET profiling tools.
- [SOS debugging extension for .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/sos-debugging-extension.md): Learn about the SOS debugging extension for .NET, which provides information about the internal CLR environment.
- [Specialized Diagnostics](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/specialized-diagnostics-overview.md): A guide to more advanced diagnostics support in .NET
- [Symbols in .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/symbols.md): An introduction to symbols and portable PDBs in .NET
- [.NET Diagnostic tools overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/tools-overview.md): An overview of the tools available to diagnose .NET Core applications.
- [Tracing .NET applications with PerfCollect.](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/trace-perfcollect-lttng.md): A tutorial that walks you through collecting a trace with perfcollect in .NET.
- [Well-known event providers in .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/diagnostics/well-known-event-providers.md): Review the providers and events published by the .NET runtime and libraries.
